newsitem.title: HONDURAS: U.S. military cargo plane crashes in Honduras.
newsitem.headline: U.S. military cargo plane crashes in Honduras.

text.p: A U.S. Hercules C-130 military cargo plane made a crash landing on Tuesday and burst into flames at Tegucigalpa's airport, firemen said, and radio reports said at least two crew members were killed.

"The plane missed the runway and burst into flames. We don't have any more details," said Fire Department official Napoleon Gomez. Radio reports said at least two people aboard were killed and another three were dragged alive from the burning aircraft.

National HRN Radio said there were nine people on the aircraft but this could not be immediately confirmed. A spokesman at Honduras' military hospital said it had received four people who were injured in the crash.
A U.S. embassy spokesman told HRN the plane, which he said had come from Panama, broke apart as it landed.
Radio reporters at the airport said they could see two charred bodies in the cockpit, but there was no official confirmation of the death toll.
